canada's job vacancies nearly reached  nearly 1 million in the first quarter of
2022 the demand in the health sector is  driving this miguel moldez will tell us
why  job vacancies in canada increased to 2.7
percent compared to the last quarter of  2021 according to statistics canada this
is equivalent to 957  500 vacancies vacancies are highest in
the healthcare and social assistance  sector reaching 136 800 jobs
this is higher from the peak of three  months earlier and higher to that of the  first quarter of 2020 in the midst of
the covet 19 pandemic majority of the  overall job vacancies in the health care
sector are positions for registered  nurses licensed practical nurses and  nurse aides meanwhile 81 500 jobs are
needed to be filled for the construction  industry  there are also a higher number of  vacancies for helpers and laborers
compared to 2020.  some steps that the government has taken  include providing hiring incentives to
employers when they hire eligible  unemployed persons to fill job vacancies  they also have a list of job
opportunities in the government's  website for global affairs canada and  job bank

u.s space agency nasa successfully  launched a rocket from australia marking
its first commercial rocket launch  outside of the united states median dog  will give us the details live
[Music]  yes maeve
kath on sunday night the rocket launched  from the newly constructed arnhem space  center in a remote area of the northern
territory on the land of the grumatch  people  the launch was delayed for about an hour
due to wind rain and clouds at the site  but the rocket finally went just after  midnight this monday morning it was only
visible for 10 seconds before  disappearing into the earth's atmosphere  labeled as a sounding rocket it is
expected to travel 300 kilometers during  the 15 minutes it moves through space
and will carry an atmospheric  observation platform to examine the  alpha a and b constellations according
to michael jones ceo of the arnhem space  center  the launch was praised as a major
turning point in the australian space  industry prime minister anthony albany  stated this project will bring together
the global and local industry to take  the country's space sector into a new  era
the rocket is the first of the three  nasa rockets to be launched from the  arnhem space center they are designed to
collect scientific information on the  physics of the sun astrophysics and  planetary science which can only be
conducted in the southern hemisphere the  second and third rockets are scheduled  to be launched on july 4 and 12
respectively back to you kath  thank you dog reporting live from
